laboratory_examinations.findings: Normal configuration of the pulmonary veins with no evidence of pulmonary vein stenosis. An accessory left atrial appendage was identified on the anterior left atrial wall, measuring 2 cm in maximal diameter and 1.5 cm in depth.
Demonstrated premature atrial contractions arising from the left superior and inferior pulmonary veins and another separate source from within the accessory left atrial appendage.
Confirmed the presence of an accessory left atrial appendage arising from the anterior wall of the left atrium.
